action.action-desc: Mr. Sullivan (for himself and Ms. Hirono) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to improve telephone communication by the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Representing VA with Accuracy Act or the REP VA Act.

section.header: Improvement of telephone communication by Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Chapter 63 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
Not later than January 1, 2026, the Secretary shall ensure that any call made to a veteran by an employee or contractor of the Department regarding services or benefits furnished by the Departmentâ€”

paragraph.text: is made from a single, well-known telephone number; and
uses caller identification branding that indicates to the veteran that the call is from or on behalf of the Department.

subsection.header: Call centers for health care appointments and referrals

paragraph.text: Not later than January 1, 2026, the Secretary shall ensure that the Veterans Health Administration has at least one call center in each of the time zones specified in paragraph (2) to address concerns regarding appointments and referrals for health care under the laws administered by the Secretary.
The time zones specified in this paragraph are the following:

The Secretary is not required to ensure that the Veterans Health Administration has a call center in any location generally within a time zone specified in paragraph (2) that does not follow daylight time.
